repnme.cdata!:
Romania - A Health Sector Reform Project in
            Support of the First Phase of the Health Sector Reform Program

abstracts.cdata!:
The Health Sector Reform Project for
            Romania had the following ratings: the outcome was
            satisfactory, the sustainability was highly likely, the
            institutional development impact was substantial, and the
            Bank and borrower performance were both satisfactory. The
            lessons learned indicate that a detailed implementation
            plan, developed in advance, is critical to ensuring timely
            project execution and organization. Continuity of
            counterpart collaboration is critical, and if there are
            unavoidable changes, prompt and effective steps must be
            taken to maintain ownership and understanding. When
            purchasing equipment which requires sustained care and
            maintenance, the funding of recurrent expenditure needs to
            be adjusted to compensate for the additional costs of more
            effective and higher qualitiy services. Encouraging reforms,
            especially in the areas of public health, requires broad
            consensus and a critical mass of stakeholder commitment if
            reforms are to succeed. Both investment and adjustment
            operations can be effectively used to further the overall
            health sector reform agenda. Availability of committed
            counterparts in each substantive area is critical to
            success, especially during periods of transitions in government.

5083595.trustfund:
TF039868-ROMANIA-HEALTH SECTOR REFORM,TF027124-PHRD-HEALTH SECTOR REFORM PROJECT,TF037823-ECA REGION - HEALTH,TF039869-ROMANIA-ROMANIA HEALTH SECTOR REFORM,TF039663-ROMANIA - HEALTH SECTOR REFORM,TF038774-ARMENIA - SUPERVISION OF
            PRIMARY HEALTH CARE PROJECTS

abstracts.cdata!:
The Health Sector Reform Project
            supports Romania to implement key elements of a long-term
            health sector development strategy and reform program which
            seeks to a) improve efficiency and equity in the planning
            and regulation of the health service delivery system; b)
            reduce preventable deaths among emergency medical cases; c)
            improve access and equality in primary health care in poor
            and remote areas; and d) help the Romanian health sector to
            better focus on priority public health problems. There are
            six project components. 1) Planning and regulation of the
            healthcare delivery system will cover district health
            service planning and strengthening the capacity of the
            Ministry of Health. 2) Essential upgrade of district
            hospitals will undertake phased implementation of an upgrade
            of essential secondary-level hospital facilities, and
            training of hospital staff in management of emergency
            medical cases. 3) Primary health care development will
            support a global strengthening of primary health care
            facilities, equipment, and staff skills. 4) Emergency
            medical services will support further development and
            extension of integrated, community-based emergency medical
            services. 5) Public health and disease control will
            establish legal and regulatory basis for public health and
            disease control, and develop a capacity to control the main
            causes of illnesses and premature deaths. 6) Project
            coordination and management will provide technical
            assistance and staff training.
